title: Drude model in FDTD solutions
snippet:
Drude model in FDTD solutionsPlasma(Drude)The Plasma model is used to create a material with the the following relative permittivity.\[\varepsilon_{total}(f)=\varepsilon- rac{\omega_p^2}{2\pi \cdot f(i
u_c+2\pi \cdot f)}\] \(\varepsilon\) : permittivity \(\omega_p\) : plasma resonance in units of rad/s \(
u_c\) : plasma collision in units of rad/sDrude modelThe dielectric function:\(\varepsilon(\omega)=\varepsilon_1(\omega)+i\varepsilon_2(\omega)\)where:\[\varepsilon_1 = \varepsilon_\infty -  rac{\omega_p^2}{\omega^2+\gamma^2}\]\[\varepsilon_2 =  rac{\omega_p^2 \gamma}{\omega(\omega^2+\gamma^2)}\]In where:\(\varepsilon_\infty\) is the high frequency dielectric permittivity, and \(\omega_p\) is the plasma frequency, and \(\gamma\) is the plasma damping.Deformation of Drude model equation in FDTD\[ egin{aligned} \varepsilon_{total}(f) &amp; =\varepsilon- rac{\omega_p^2}{2\pi \cdot f(i

Plasma frequency \(\omega_p\) (unit: rad/s) in FDTD equals to the \(\omega_p / 2\pi\) in Drude model. Plasma collision \(
u_c\) (unit: rad/s) in FDTD equals to the \(\gamma\) in Drude model. Frequency \(f\) (unit: rad/s) in FDTD equals to the \(\omega/2\pi\) in Drude model.

title: Stop VASP during the program execution
snippet: STOPCARDuring the VASP program execution, we can creat a file names STOPCAR to stop the program.If the STOPCAR contains the line:LSTOP = .TRUE.then VASP will stop at the next ionic step.If the STOPCAR contains the line:LABORT = .TRUE.VASP stops at the next electronic step, i.e. WAVECAR and CHGCAR might contain non converged results.If possible use the first option.Reference:STOPCAR - Vaspwiki
